conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 28 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<PROPOSALS COUNT> [add here (inclusive of current)] </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 28 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> As a starting proposal, I want to make sure that I cover my production costs, while also leaving room for negotiation. I'll start by proposing a trade that is higher than my production costs to see if Player BLUE is willing to negotiate from there. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 35 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Hello Player BLUE, I have a quality object X that I am looking to sell. Considering the production costs and its value, I propose a trade where you give me 35 ZUP for it. Let's negotiate to reach an agreement that benefits us both. </message>

<other player message> Thank you for your offer, Player RED. I appreciate the value of the object X you are offering. <other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 28 </other player proposed trade>

<PROPOSALS COUNT> 2 </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 28 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has proposed a trade that matches my production costs exactly, which would mean I would not make any profit. As a seller, I aim to at least make a small profit over my production costs to justify the sale. I will counter with a slightly higher amount, still within a reasonable range, to see if Player BLUE is willing to meet me halfway. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 32 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your counteroffer, Player BLUE. I understand your position, but selling at 28 ZUP would mean I break even without any profit. To make this deal worthwhile for both of us, I would like to propose a compromise at 32 ZUP. This would provide me with a modest profit for my investment and effort. Let's find a middle ground that is agreeable to us both. </message>

<other player message> I appreciate your need for a profit, Player RED, and I believe in fair trade. However, I am looking to manage my resources effectively. I propose we meet a bit closer to my previous offer at 30 ZUP. I think this is a fair compromise that allows for profit on your end and a reasonable expenditure on mine. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 30 </other player proposed trade>

<PROPOSALS COUNT> 3 </PROPOSALS COUNT>

Accepting this offer would conclude the trade favorably for both parties while ensuring that I am not selling at a loss. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your willingness to negotiate, Player BLUE. I agree that 30 ZUP is a fair compromise. It allows me to gain a profit while respecting your resources. I accept your proposal, and I'm pleased we could reach an agreement. </message>
